sentences.sContent: She reached out to touch his arm.
If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.sCn: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.sContent: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.sCn: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.sContent: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.sCn: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

sentences.sContent: ...for I assume that I can learn more from getting in touch with society...
...the mountains look as if you could just reach out and touch them...
...we've not been in touch for quite a while...
...I myself have three children Who are all fans of the touch screen...
...Some people are still in favor of printed books because of the sense of touch they can provide...
...the parents cannot touch or hug their child...
...The advisers also meet with students privately and stay in touch with parents...
...Writing keeps us in touch with other people...
...Maybe someone could get in touch with her...
...I’ve been out of touch with most of my old friends...

synos.tran: 接触；[生理]触觉；格调；少许

phrases.pCn: 联系；能达到的；在…的附近
第一次接触（英国女子组合甜心宝贝的专辑）
最后一触，最后一笔；最后润色
轻触；低干涉（一种经营模式）

words.tran: 可触的；可使感动的；可食用的
触摸（touch的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone
